titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Archives of Industrial Society (AIS) General Photograph Collection, 1895-present AIS.Photos
titlestmt.author: Miriam Meislik and Shelby Campbell.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 10:06:35 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Archives of Industrial Society (AIS) General Photograph Collection
did.abstract: Photographs from the Archives of Industrial Society (AIS) vertical file and smaller collections gathered under one designation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Photographs cover a wide range of topics relating to the history of Pittsburgh including neighborhoods, infrastructure, and landscape. Collection containing loose images which have no formal collection assignment and gathered together under one heading for the purposes of online presentation. Images are contained within the AIS vertical photo file.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Digital reproductions of selected images from the collection are online.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Photographs are arranged topically in folders.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Archives of Industrial Society (AIS) General Photograph Collection, 1895-present, AIS.Photos, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Archives of Industrial Society (AIS) General Photograph Collection, 1895-present, AIS.Photos, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: This collection will continue to receive new photographic images since it is a general collection of AIS photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Photographic prints and negatives documenting Allegheny Valley Railroad equipment, stations, and employees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Joseph A. Borkowski, a University of Pittsburgh alumni, was Chairman of the Polish Historical Commission during 1960. Photographis in this folder include Borkowski with members of the commission as well as other photographs with Mayor Joseph Barr and Congressman Wililam Moorhead, snapshots taken between 1950 and 1959, and the unveiling of the William B. Foster Memoria (May 15, 1955).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Folder contains one printed card documenting the history of courthouses in Pittsburgh and one photograph published by the Pittsburgh Sun-Telegraph with the caption, "Beauty By Night: Courthouse In Its Glory The new nocturnal glory for the country courthosue, nightly showered with light since its thorough cleaning."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Interior and exterior views of the J. M. Taylor house located on Craft Avenue in Pittsburgh's Oakland neighborhood as well as plans showing surrounding streets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Photographs of the Sons of Italy Banquet, St. Anthony of Padua Church, and negatives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: Unidentified family photographs and negatives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Three 16x20 color aerial photographic prints of Oakland taken by Norman W. Schumm August 12, 1968. Identified as 686018-276-B, 686068-274-B, and 686027-271. Used in Leonard G Martin's book, "Forbes Field-Build-It-Yourself." Accession AIS.2015.15

did.unittitle: Waynesburg and Washington Railroad Photo Collection
